concepts.definition: The process by which plants use sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide to produce glucose and oxygen

variations.text: Plants convert sunlight into energy through photosynthesis
Photosynthesis produces all the oxygen we breathe

concepts.definition: The force that attracts objects toward each other, especially toward the center of the Earth

variations.text: Gravity keeps us on the ground and makes objects fall
The strength of gravity depends on the mass of objects and distance between them

concepts.definition: Deoxyribonucleic acid, the molecule that carries genetic information in living organisms

variations.text: DNA determines traits like eye color and height
Human DNA is 99.9% identical between all people

concepts.definition: The smallest unit of matter that retains the properties of an element

variations.text: Everything around us is made of atoms
Atoms consist of protons, neutrons, and electrons

concepts.definition: A community of living organisms interacting with their physical environment

variations.text: A forest ecosystem includes trees, animals, soil, and climate
Ecosystems can be as small as a pond or as large as a desert
